intro: Andaca arabica, commonly known as Arabica coffee. It is a species of the Rubiaceae family, native to the highlands of Ethiopia and surrounding regions. The plant is a shrub that produces red, fleshy berries containing two seeds, which are the coffee beans used for brewing. Arabica plants thrive in cool, humid climates with well-drained soil and require shade for optimal growth. Its beans are prized for their mild flavor and high acidity, making it one of the most popular coffee varieties worldwide.
